clinical_study.brief_title: Conventional and Ultrasonic Implant Site Preparation
clinical_study.official_title: Immediate Loading After Conventional and Ultrasonic Implant Site Preparation: a Multicenter Randomized Controlled Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: multi center study with randomized controlled trial design, split mouth

detailed_description.textblock: The present study has been designed as a multicenter prospective randomized controlled trial design. Fifteen clinical centers will treat patients by inserting and immediately loading implants with two different surgical protocols. Each patient will receive two identical implants: after randomization, the test site will be prepared by ultrasonic microvibrations and the control site using twist drills. Both implants will be loaded with a provisional crown within 48 hours after surgery. For each inserted implant, collection of experimental parameters will be required up to 2 years after surgery.

study_design_info.masking_description: treatment method is masked till the surgical procedure, during which, both surgeon and patient are informed

primary_outcome.description: how many implant are present in mouth

secondary_outcome.description: implant stable and fulfilling success criteria
every complication linked to the crown, implant abutment structure

intervention.description: piezoelectric bone surgery will be used to create implant bone ostectomy
twist drills will be used to create implant bone ostectomy
